intro: Aegiphila monstrosa, commonly known as the Brazilian mountain sage, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Brazil. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Aegiphila monstrosa is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
